intro: Calyptridium pulchellum, commonly known as the pink sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to lavender-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Calyptridium pulchellum is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
